topic: “He couldn’t stand up so I hit him over the head with my bass. He fell to the floor. I ran away… I didn’t know if he was still alive”: The bassist who survived Fairport Convention, Jethro Tull and believing he’d murdered his bandmate on stage

ideas.title: The Opera House Rock
ideas.premise: The bassist, wearing a Fairport Convention t-shirt, is trying to explain to a bewildered police officer outside the Sydney Opera House that he only hit his bandmate because 'he couldn't stand up' after too many schooners at the pub.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposition of high culture and low-brow pub behaviour, quintessential Aussie excuse.

ideas.title: Mars Needs Bassists
ideas.premise: Astronauts on Mars discover a perfectly preserved bass guitar with a dent in it; one astronaut nervously asks, 'Do you think *he's* up here?'
ideas.why_funny: Combines the space exploration news angle with the original story's guilty conscience.

ideas.title: Robin Hooding the Stage
ideas.premise: A bassist dressed as Robin Hood (feathered cap and all) swings down from the Enmore Theatre rafters, steals a microphone, and uses it to amplify the sound of his bass hitting another band member.
ideas.why_funny: Absurdity of Robin Hood stealing from…himself? And the practical application of microphone theft.

ideas.title: Marathon Man Down Under
ideas.premise: During the Sydney Marathon, a runner dressed as a bass guitar trips another runner; the bass-runner mutters, 'He couldn't stand up...', before running away.
ideas.why_funny: Running joke (literally) about the bass player's excuse in an unexpected context.

ideas.title: The Detox After Tull
ideas.premise: The bassist is in a Bondi detox clinic, surrounded by seaweed wraps and kale smoothies, confessing, 'It was the flute solos, officer, they drove me to it!'
ideas.why_funny: Linking Jethro Tull's perceived flute excess to a uniquely Sydney health obsession.
